alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 8:28PM EST until February 01 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Ohio River at Pittsburgh. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela Parking Wharf. At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the North Shore riverwalk between the stadiums. At 19.5 feet, The Monongahela Parking Wharf is completely flooded. At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower areas of the North Shore Riverwalk. At 22.0 feet, The Tenth Street Bypass floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Sunday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. The river will then slowly fall to below 18 feet by Thursday evening. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
